subclusters.subcluster_name: Replicative Senescence and Telomere-Driven Cellular Senescence Theory
Tumor Suppression and Cell Cycle Arrest in Cellular Senescence Theory
SASP-Mediated Inflammation and Tissue Dysfunction in Cellular Senescence Theory
Dual Role and Heterogeneity of Cellular Senescence Theory
Epigenetic and Chromatin Remodeling Regulation of Cellular Senescence Theory

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Replicative Senescence and Telomere-Driven Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on replicative limit of cell division and telomere shortening as primary triggers of senescence and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Replicative Senescence and Telomere-Driven Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes telomere shortening as a mitotic clock and replicative senescence mechanisms converging on p53 and pRb pathways.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Replicative Senescence and Telomere-Driven Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Highlights telomere shortening triggering senescence and accumulation of senescent cells with age.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Replicative Senescence and Telomere-Driven Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes replicative senescence via telomere shortening and DNA damage response pathways involving p53 and p16.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Replicative Senescence and Telomere-Driven Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Details replicative senescence in endothelial cells with G1 arrest and senescence-associated apoptosis linked to replicative limits.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Tumor Suppression and Cell Cycle Arrest in Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on senescence as a tumor suppressive barrier mediated by CDKN2a locus and cell cycle checkpoint activation.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Tumor Suppression and Cell Cycle Arrest in Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes senescence as a tumor suppressive mechanism with permanent cell cycle arrest and antagonistic pleiotropy.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Tumor Suppression and Cell Cycle Arrest in Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on p16INK4a-mediated cell cycle arrest balancing tumor suppression and aging effects.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Tumor Suppression and Cell Cycle Arrest in Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes p53 regulation of senescence and ROS with dual roles in tumor suppression and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Tumor Suppression and Cell Cycle Arrest in Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Details p53-p21 and p16-pRB pathways controlling senescence and tumor suppression.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: SASP-Mediated Inflammation and Tissue Dysfunction in Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Highlights senescence-associated secretory phenotype (SASP) causing inflammation and tissue disruption.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: SASP-Mediated Inflammation and Tissue Dysfunction in Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on SASP-driven chronic inflammation and fibrosis promoting organ degeneration.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: SASP-Mediated Inflammation and Tissue Dysfunction in Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes SASP secretion causing local and systemic inflammation and aging phenotypes.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: SASP-Mediated Inflammation and Tissue Dysfunction in Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes SASP in adipose tissue driving inflammation and metabolic dysfunction.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: SASP-Mediated Inflammation and Tissue Dysfunction in Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes SASP promoting inflammation and metabolic disease in aging and obesity.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: SASP-Mediated Inflammation and Tissue Dysfunction in Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Links SASP to chronic inflammation and age-related diseases including depression.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: SASP-Mediated Inflammation and Tissue Dysfunction in Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on SASP secretion disrupting tissue homeostasis and promoting aging phenotypes.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: SASP-Mediated Inflammation and Tissue Dysfunction in Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Highlights SASP-driven chronic inflammation and resistance to apoptosis in senescent cells.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: SASP-Mediated Inflammation and Tissue Dysfunction in Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes SASP regulated by NF-κB driving inflammation and tissue dysfunction in aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Dual Role and Heterogeneity of Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on senescence roles in development, repair, and aging with heterogeneity in cell types and stimuli.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Dual Role and Heterogeneity of Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes senescence in multiple brain cell types contributing to neurodegeneration and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Dual Role and Heterogeneity of Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Discusses somatic cell senescence limiting organ repair and transplant outcomes with age-related heterogeneity.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Epigenetic and Chromatin Remodeling Regulation of Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on epigenetic changes and chromatin architecture driving senescence onset and maintenance.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Epigenetic and Chromatin Remodeling Regulation of Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes redox-sensitive regulation of p53 isoforms affecting senescence and aging via epigenetic mechanisms.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Epigenetic and Chromatin Remodeling Regulation of Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Shows mTOR signaling modulates senescence phenotypes and can reverse senescence via epigenetic pathways.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Autophagy Decline and Cellular Senescence Interaction Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on age-related decline in autophagy impairing cellular homeostasis and promoting senescence.
